fields.title: A Bay of Blood
fields.description: Mario Bava’s gruesome proto-slasher with inventive kills and a tangled inheritance plot. Influenced "Friday the 13th."
fields.special_features: 2K restoration. Interviews with Lamberto Bava and critics. Commentary by Tim Lucas. Italian and English cuts. Illustrated insert booklet
fields.censor_status: Censored in US and UK in 70s/80s

fields.title: Altered States
fields.description: A mind-bending sci-fi drama about an experiment pushing human consciousness to extremes.
fields.special_features: Restored Cut (High-quality remaster), William Hurt Interview (Discussing method acting approach), Behind-the-Scenes Documentary (Examining special effects)
fields.censor_status: No censorship issues

fields.title: Alucarda
fields.description: Juan López Moctezuma's surreal Mexican horror about demonic possession in a convent. Known for its wild imagery and intense performances.
fields.special_features: HD remaster. Interview with Guillermo del Toro on Moctezuma. Commentary by film historian Abraham Castillo Flores. Trailers. Archival photos & posters
fields.censor_status: Uncut in US, censored in UK upon release

fields.title: Angst
fields.description: A harrowing psychological horror following the chilling mind of a violent killer.
fields.special_features: Uncut Version (Includes previously censored sequences), Making-of Featurette (Examining stark realism), Director’s Commentary (Discussing controversial themes)
fields.censor_status: Banned in some regions for graphic violence; later restored
fields.packaging: Hardbound slipcase with minimalist horror aesthetic

fields.title: Audition
fields.description: A slow-burn horror-thriller about a widower’s dating experiment gone wrong.
fields.special_features: Uncut Version (Includes previously censored torture sequences), Making-of Featurette (Examining pacing and tension), Director’s Commentary (Miike discusses storytelling techniques)
fields.censor_status: Originally censored in the UK due to extreme violence; later released uncut
fields.packaging: Elegant slipcase with minimalist horror aesthetic

fields.title: Basket Case
fields.description: A man arrives in NYC with a basket — containing his deformed, telepathic twin. Frank Henenlotter’s low-budget horror is weird and unforgettable.
fields.special_features: 4K digital restoration. Commentary with Henenlotter. "What's in the Basket?" doc (38 min). Behind-the-scenes footage and outtakes. Collector's booklet with essays. Archival interview with Kevin Van Hentenryck
fields.censor_status: Banned in the UK in early 1980s; later released uncut
fields.packaging: Clear case with slipcover, poster, booklet

fields.title: Battle Royale
fields.description: A controversial Japanese thriller where students fight to the death in a government-sanctioned event.
fields.special_features: Director’s Commentary. Deep dive into themes and impact. Survival Guide Featurette. Exploring the film’s cultural influence. Deleted Scenes. Unseen footage from early edits.
fields.censor_status: Initially refused classification in the UK, then released uncut.
fields.packaging: Hardbound slipcase featuring school uniform aesthetic.

fields.title: Begotten
fields.description: E. Elias Merhige’s haunting, wordless tale of death and rebirth. Shot in extreme contrast, it has become an icon of underground cinema.
fields.special_features: Restoration from original negatives. Director commentary. "Birth of a Film" making-of featurette. Visual essays. Limited edition booklet
fields.censor_status: Uncut worldwide, but difficult to classify

fields.title: Beyond the Black Rainbow
fields.description: A slow-burn psychedelic sci-fi thriller with hypnotic visuals.
fields.special_features: Director’s Commentary (Exploring cryptic storytelling), Deleted Scenes (Extended sequences), Behind-the-Scenes Documentary (Examining cinematography)
fields.censor_status: No censorship issues but widely debated for surreal storytelling

fields.title: Black Moon
fields.description: A surreal fantasy film blending Alice in Wonderland-inspired elements with dystopian themes.
fields.special_features: Restored Version (High-definition transfer), Behind-the-Scenes Documentary (Exploring dreamlike imagery), Director’s Commentary (Examining avant-garde storytelling)
fields.censor_status: No censorship issues; remains an underappreciated gem

fields.title: Black Sunday
fields.description: A gothic horror masterpiece about a cursed witch seeking revenge from beyond the grave.
fields.special_features: Restored Edition (Fully remastered visuals), Behind-the-Scenes Documentary (Examining gothic horror influences), Director’s Commentary (Discussing cinematography)
fields.censor_status: Originally censored in the UK for violent imagery; later released uncut

fields.title: Blood Feast
fields.description: One of the earliest gore films, featuring violent ritual murders.
fields.special_features: Herschell Gordon Lewis Interview (Discussing gore impact), Behind-the-Scenes Featurette (Examining practical effects), Deleted Scenes (Previously cut content restored)
fields.censor_status: Originally censored in the UK due to extreme violence; later released uncut
fields.packaging: Retro-style slipcase with bold horror artwork

fields.title: Bloodsucking Freaks
fields.description: A graphic horror-satire about a sadistic theatre group engaging in brutal acts.
fields.special_features: Uncut Version (Restored banned sequences). Behind-the-Scenes Featurette (Examining controversial production). Director’s Commentary (Discussing cult legacy).
fields.censor_status: Originally banned in the UK for extreme violence; later released uncut
fields.packaging: Blood-red slipcase with underground theatre styling

fields.title: Blue Velvet
fields.description: David Lynch’s mystery of small-town darkness begins with a severed ear and leads into a world of voyeurism, violence, and unforgettable performances.
fields.special_features: 4K restoration approved by Lynch. "Mysteries of Love" doc (70 min). 50 mins of deleted scenes. Interview with Lynch and cast. Collector booklet with essays
fields.censor_status: Uncut worldwide, though faced criticism for content in 1986

fields.title: Brazil
fields.description: A bureaucrat in a dystopian future is trapped in a totalitarian state’s paperwork and fantasy. Gilliam’s satire of surveillance and madness remains hauntingly relevant.
fields.special_features: Director’s final cut (142 min) in HD. "The Battle of Brazil" documentary (55 min). Commentary with Terry Gilliam. Interviews with cast (Pryce, Palin, Greist). Deleted scenes. 30-page booklet with Gilliam’s production notes
fields.censor_status: US theatrical cut trimmed by Universal; director’s cut restored on home video

fields.title: Café Flesh
fields.description: A post-apocalyptic erotic sci-fi film set in a world where most people are too sick to have sex. Cult classic of alt-adult cinema.
fields.special_features: Restored uncut version. Interview with director Rinse Dream. Behind-the-scenes featurette. Collectible booklet. Rare promo artwork gallery
fields.censor_status: Censored and banned in several countries

fields.title: Cannibal Holocaust
fields.description: Ruggero Deodato’s infamous found-footage horror that shocked the world with its realistic gore and social critique.
fields.special_features: Newly remastered in HD. Commentary by Deodato. "Animal Cruelty Controversy" doc. Alternate cuts. Essay booklet
fields.censor_status: Banned in over 50 countries
fields.packaging: Hard slipcase with booklet and art cards

fields.title: Cemetery Man
fields.description: A zombie film like no other, combining romance, absurdism, and Italian gore. Directed by Michele Soavi and starring Rupert Everett.
fields.special_features: New HD master from original negatives. Interviews with Michele Soavi. Commentary track by author Alan Jones. Theatrical and international trailers. Collector’s booklet
fields.censor_status: Originally censored in UK for gore

fields.title: Combat Shock
fields.description: A disturbing drama about a traumatized Vietnam vet spiraling into despair.
fields.special_features: Director’s Commentary (Discussing harsh realism), Deleted Scenes (Extended sequences), Behind-the-Scenes Documentary (Examining gritty cinematography)
fields.censor_status: Not officially banned but considered highly disturbing

fields.title: Dagon
fields.description: A Lovecraft-inspired horror film about a man trapped in an eerie fishing town.
fields.special_features: Restored Cut (Remastered version), Director’s Commentary (Examining Lovecraftian themes), Deleted Scenes (Extended sequences)
fields.censor_status: No censorship issues; widely appreciated in horror circles
fields.packaging: Slipcase with dark atmospheric sea-themed artwork

fields.title: Daisies
fields.description: Věra Chytilová’s feminist Czech New Wave classic follows two rebellious women through anarchic acts of surrealism and destruction.
fields.special_features: New 4K digital restoration. Interview with Czech scholars. Audio commentary. Archival photos and booklet. Fold-out poster
fields.censor_status: Banned in Czechoslovakia (1966)

fields.title: Dark Star
fields.description: John Carpenter’s hilarious low-budget debut: stoned astronauts try to destroy unstable planets in deep space.
fields.special_features: 2K scan of theatrical cut. Commentary by Carpenter and O’Bannon. "Let There Be Light" doc. Student film version. Still gallery
fields.censor_status: Uncut worldwide

fields.title: Daughters of Darkness
fields.description: Belgian erotic vampire film starring Delphine Seyrig. Lavish visuals and sexual ambiguity make it a cult favorite in queer and gothic horror circles.
fields.special_features: 4K scan from original negative. Interviews with cast and crew. Commentary by Kat Ellinger. Archival trailers and photo gallery. 40-page booklet
fields.censor_status: Uncut worldwide

fields.title: Dead Alive (Braindead)
fields.description: A bizarre zombie outbreak begins after a Sumatran rat-monkey bites a domineering mother. Peter Jackson’s film is pure splatter mayhem.
fields.special_features: Full uncut version (97 min). Commentary with Peter Jackson. Featurette: "Gore & Gags" (18 min). Lobby card reproduction (Anchor Bay). Original trailer
fields.censor_status: Banned in South Korea and censored in Germany; uncut on most DVDs

fields.title: Dead Heat
fields.description: A horror-comedy about a pair of undead cops battling criminals from beyond the grave.
fields.special_features: Restored Print (High-quality remaster), Making-of Featurette (Examining horror-comedy blend), Deleted Scenes (Extended sequences)
fields.censor_status: No censorship issues but regarded as obscure in horror circles

fields.title: Dead Ringers
fields.description: Cronenberg’s psychological thriller about twin gynecologists sharing disturbing obsessions.
fields.special_features: Restored Version (Enhanced transfer), Cast Interviews (Discussing performances), Director’s Commentary (Exploring psychological themes)
fields.censor_status: No censorship issues but regarded as highly disturbing

fields.title: Deadbeat at Dawn
fields.description: DIY cult action film by Jim Van Bebber, about gang warfare, martial arts, and revenge in gritty urban alleys.
fields.special_features: 2K scan from original 16mm. Interviews with Van Bebber. Deleted scenes. Making-of documentary. Commentary track
fields.censor_status: Uncut worldwide

fields.title: Death Laid an Egg
fields.description: A psychedelic Italian giallo set in a futuristic chicken farm. Genre-defying, stylish, and full of anti-capitalist subtext.
fields.special_features: 2K scan. Commentary by film historians. Interviews with cast. Trailers and promo materials. Essay booklet
fields.censor_status: Uncut worldwide

fields.title: Deathdream
fields.description: A psychological horror exploring the haunting aftermath of a soldier returning from war—possibly undead.
fields.special_features: Director’s Commentary (Examining Vietnam War themes), Restored Cut (Fully remastered), Behind-the-Scenes Featurette (Exploring practical effects)
fields.censor_status: No censorship issues but remained an underrated horror gem

fields.title: Deep End
fields.description: A psychological drama-thriller about obsession and youthful naivety.
fields.special_features: Restored Print (High-quality transfer), Behind-the-Scenes Documentary (Exploring themes of teenage obsession), Deleted Scenes (Extended footage)
fields.censor_status: No censorship issues but considered controversial

fields.title: Deep Red
fields.description: Dario Argento’s masterpiece of giallo horror about a pianist who witnesses a brutal murder and uncovers a dark conspiracy.
fields.special_features: 4K restoration. Both Italian and English versions. Interviews with Daria Nicolodi & Argento. Music videos and trailer reel. Booklet with essays
fields.censor_status: Censored in US/UK on initial release

fields.title: Donnie Darko
fields.description: A troubled teen sees visions of a monstrous rabbit predicting the apocalypse. Part time-loop thriller, part teen angst drama, this cult hit gained a major following post-release.
fields.special_features: Director’s Cut + Theatrical (HD). 2 commentaries: Kelly + Gyllenhaal, cast/crew. "The Philosophy of Time Travel" doc (52 min). Deleted scenes and extended interviews. 40-page booklet with essays and artwork
fields.censor_status: Uncut worldwide, but pulled from some US cinemas after 9/11 due to plane imagery
fields.packaging: Hardbound case with reversible sleeve and poster

fields.title: Dust Devil
fields.description: A psychological horror-thriller about a supernatural killer roaming South Africa.
fields.special_features: Director’s Commentary (Exploring folklore influences), Deleted Scenes (Extended sequences), Making-of Featurette (Examining production challenges)
fields.censor_status: Not banned but remained obscure for years
fields.packaging: Slipcase featuring eerie desert horror artwork

fields.title: Eating Raoul
fields.description: A dark horror-comedy about a couple turning to murder as their business model.
fields.special_features: Behind-the-Scenes Documentary (Examining cult popularity), Cast Interviews (Discussing satirical elements), Deleted Scenes (Extended sequences)
fields.censor_status: No censorship issues but remained obscure for years

fields.title: El Topo
fields.description: A mystical gunslinger wanders through allegorical duels in Jodorowsky’s spiritual Western. Bizarre, violent, and profound.
fields.special_features: 2K restoration. Commentary with Jodorowsky. "Midnight Madness: The El Topo Story" (40 min). Vintage interview with Allen Ginsberg on El Topo. 32-page booklet with film stills and symbolism breakdown
fields.censor_status: Banned in some Latin American countries in 1970s. Now restored.

fields.title: Enter the Void
fields.description: A psychedelic visual odyssey depicting life after death from a first-person perspective.
fields.special_features: Restored Print (Enhanced visual clarity), Gaspar Noé Interview (Exploring artistic vision), Deleted Scenes (Extended sequences)
fields.censor_status: Not banned but heavily debated for explicit content

fields.title: Eraserhead
fields.description: David Lynch’s nightmare industrial horror debut about a man navigating fatherhood and existential dread in a surreal, decaying world.
fields.special_features: Lynch-approved 4K restoration. Short film "Six Men Getting Sick". Interviews with cast and crew. 60-page hardcover booklet. Rare stills gallery
fields.censor_status: Uncut worldwide

fields.title: Evil Dead Trap
fields.description: A Japanese horror cult classic involving deadly traps in an abandoned location.
fields.special_features: Restored Print (Complete remaster), Director’s Commentary (Discussing stylistic influences), Special Effects Featurette (Examining practical gore effects)
fields.censor_status: Not banned but classified strictly due to violent content
fields.packaging: Hardcase slipcover with blood-red themed art

fields.title: Faces of Death
fields.description: A disturbing faux-documentary blending staged and real death footage.
fields.special_features: Staged Death Explanations. Breakdown of fake vs. real footage. Banned Footage Compilation. Cut scenes restored for archival purposes. Interview with Director. Examining the film’s intent and controversy.
fields.censor_status: Banned outright in the UK for decades due to graphic depictions. Later released with heavy cuts.

fields.title: Fantastic Planet
fields.description: René Laloux’s animated French sci-fi epic tells of a future where humans are kept as pets by giant blue aliens. Haunting and philosophical.
fields.special_features: New digital restoration. "Laloux sauvage" making-of doc. 2 early short films by Laloux. Essay booklet and art cards. Original French audio with subs
fields.censor_status: Uncut worldwide

fields.title: Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas
fields.description: Terry Gilliam’s hallucinatory adaptation of Hunter S. Thompson’s gonzo odyssey, with Johnny Depp and Benicio del Toro at their manic peak.
fields.special_features: Director & Depp commentary. Hunter S. Thompson interview. "Gonzo Journalism" documentary. Storyboards and production designs. Booklet with Thompson writings
fields.censor_status: Uncut worldwide

fields.title: Female Prisoner #701: Scorpion
fields.description: Matsu is wrongfully imprisoned and becomes a vengeful symbol of resistance in this stylized, brutal Japanese exploitation film.
fields.special_features: 2K restoration. Commentary by Jasper Sharp. Archival interview with Shunya Itō (22 min). Japanese trailers. Gallery of original poster art. 20-page booklet by Tom Mes
fields.censor_status: Uncut in Japan; some brief nudity censored on initial US DVD

fields.title: Female Trouble
fields.description: John Waters and Divine explode with shocking trash glamour in this tale of crime, beauty obsession, and electroshock treatment.
fields.special_features: Restoration from original negatives. Waters commentary. Cast interviews. "Divine Trash" retrospective. Booklet essay by critic Alonso Duralde
fields.censor_status: Uncut in US, controversial internationally

fields.title: Forbidden Zone
fields.description: A black-and-white musical fantasy that plays like a Looney Tunes cartoon on acid. Danny Elfman's band Oingo Boingo stars.
fields.special_features: Director’s commentary. Cast interviews. Restored color sequences. Alternate musical tracks. Behind-the-scenes feature
fields.censor_status: Uncut worldwide

fields.title: Ganja & Hess
fields.description: Bill Gunn’s avant-garde vampire film reclaims Black cinema and critiques addiction and religion. A radical milestone.
fields.special_features: HD restoration by Museum of Modern Art. Gunn’s recut "Blood Couple". Interviews and scholarly essays. Audio commentary by film historians. Essay booklet
fields.censor_status: Censored and recut without Gunn’s approval originally

fields.title: Girly
fields.description: A twisted British horror-comedy about a dysfunctional aristocratic family luring outsiders into deadly games.
fields.special_features: Director’s Commentary (Examining satirical horror). Making-of Documentary (Exploring cult legacy). Deleted Scenes (Extended sequences)
fields.censor_status: No censorship issues but largely unknown outside niche audiences
fields.packaging: Slipcase featuring eerie vintage horror artwork

fields.title: Goke, Body Snatcher from Hell
fields.description: A mind-bending Japanese alien horror film where survivors of a plane crash are hunted by a body-possessing alien parasite.
fields.special_features: Remastered HD transfer. Audio commentary by Asian cinema expert Jasper Sharp. Trailer gallery. Illustrated booklet with film analysis
fields.censor_status: Uncut worldwide

fields.title: Gozu
fields.description: A disturbing psychological horror with surreal Lynchian influences.
fields.special_features: Director’s Commentary (Exploring themes and inspirations), Deleted Scenes (Unseen footage), Making-of Documentary (Insights into bizarre practical effects)
fields.censor_status: Not banned, but some versions omitted explicit sequences

fields.title: Gummo
fields.description: A bizarre, non-linear film depicting life in an impoverished American town.
fields.special_features: Director’s Commentary (Harmony Korine discusses influences), Behind-the-Scenes Documentary (Examining unconventional filmmaking techniques), Deleted Scenes (Additional unused footage)
fields.censor_status: Not banned, but faced extreme controversy for disturbing content
fields.packaging: Slipcase with raw, documentary-style cover art

fields.title: Hardware
fields.description: Richard Stanley’s post-apocalyptic cyberpunk horror about a killer robot loose in a grungy future apartment.
fields.special_features: 2K scan from original negatives. Stanley commentary. Behind-the-scenes doc. Deleted scenes. Collectors booklet
fields.censor_status: Banned in UK during Video Nasty panic

fields.title: Henry: Portrait of a Serial Killer
fields.description: A disturbing crime drama loosely based on real-life serial killer Henry Lee Lucas.
fields.special_features: Psychological Horror Documentary (Exploring its realistic violence), Restored Version (High-definition transfer), Director’s Commentary (Discussing themes)
fields.censor_status: Initially banned in the UK for graphic violence; later released with cuts
fields.packaging: Matte-black slipcase featuring chilling portrait artwork

fields.title: House
fields.description: A group of schoolgirls visits a haunted house where they are devoured by beds, pianos, and more in a surreal, psychedelic nightmare.
fields.special_features: Restored digital transfer. Interview with director Nobuhiko Obayashi (18 min). Appreciation by Ti West (10 min). Original trailers and posters. Fold-out poster and booklet with essay by Chuck Stephens
fields.censor_status: Uncut worldwide. Mild edits in rare early VHS editions
fields.packaging: Digipak with illustrated slipcover and fold-out poster

fields.title: House of 1000 Corpses
fields.description: Rob Zombie’s gruesome horror film about a family of sadistic killers.
fields.special_features: Uncut Version (Includes previously censored brutality), Behind-the-Scenes Documentary (Examining production design), Deleted Scenes (Additional violent sequences)
fields.censor_status: Originally released in a cut version; uncut editions later available

fields.title: I Spit on Your Grave
fields.description: A revenge thriller depicting brutal assault and vengeance.
fields.special_features: Making-of Documentary. Behind-the-scenes with cast and director. Uncut Version. Features restored sequences previously removed. Rape-Revenge Discussion Featurette. Examining the controversial subgenre.
fields.censor_status: Initially banned in the UK, released with cuts before an uncut version emerged later.
fields.packaging: Classic-style slipcase with restored poster artwork.

fields.title: I Stand Alone
fields.description: A bleak, nihilistic thriller about an angry butcher's descent into violent madness.
fields.special_features: Director’s Commentary (Gaspar Noé discusses brutal themes), Behind-the-Scenes Documentary (Examining intense cinematography), Deleted Scenes (Extended sequences)
fields.censor_status: Not banned but released with warnings due to extreme content
fields.packaging: Matte-black slipcase with minimalist brutalist design

fields.title: Ichi the Killer
fields.description: Takashi Miike’s hyper-violent tale of sadism, loyalty, and gang warfare, infamous for its extreme content and satire.
fields.special_features: Director’s cut. Interview with Miike. "Ichi Revisited" featurette. Behind-the-scenes. Manga comparison feature
fields.censor_status: Heavily censored in UK and Germany

fields.title: In a Glass Cage
fields.description: A deeply disturbing psychological horror about a paralyzed ex-Nazi haunted by his past.
fields.special_features: Uncut Version (Includes previously censored sequences), Making-of Documentary (Examining dark themes), Director’s Commentary (Discussing the film’s impact)
fields.censor_status: Banned in some countries due to extreme subject matter
fields.packaging: Matte-black slipcase with minimalist brutalist design

fields.title: Kuroneko
fields.description: A hauntingly stylized Japanese ghost tale of two women who return as vengeful spirits to seduce and kill samurai. Beautifully shot, eerie, and tragic.
fields.special_features: Restored HD transfer. Interview with director Kaneto Shindo. Commentary by film historian Donald Richie. Illustrated booklet with essays
fields.censor_status: Uncut worldwide

fields.title: Let the Right One In
fields.description: A haunting Swedish vampire drama about a lonely boy who befriends a mysterious girl.
fields.special_features: Deleted Scenes (Unused footage restored), Director’s Commentary (Exploring character dynamics), Behind-the-Scenes Documentary (Examining production design)
fields.censor_status: No censorship issues; widely released uncut

fields.title: Let's Scare Jessica to Death
fields.description: A psychological horror about a mentally fragile woman facing supernatural visions.
fields.special_features: Remastered Cut (Restored from original print), Making-of Documentary (Examining tension-building techniques), Deleted Scenes (Extended footage)
fields.censor_status: No censorship issues but regarded as an underappreciated cult film
fields.packaging: Hardcover slipcase with retro eerie artwork

fields.title: Liquid Sky
fields.description: An androgynous model in NYC discovers that aliens are killing people during orgasm in this experimental cult sci-fi.
fields.special_features: Restored 4K transfer. Commentary with director Slava Tsukerman. "Liquid Sky Revisited" doc. Interviews with cast and crew. 28-page booklet with essays and photos
fields.censor_status: Uncut worldwide

fields.title: Man Bites Dog
fields.description: A dark satire following a documentary crew filming a charismatic serial killer.
fields.special_features: Making-of Documentary. Behind-the-scenes insight into the film’s realism. Deleted Scenes. Footage removed for pacing and censorship reasons. Cinematic Violence Featurette. Exploring the ethical questions posed by the film.
fields.censor_status: Banned in the UK on first release, later restored uncut.

fields.title: Mandy
fields.description: A psychedelic revenge thriller starring Nicolas Cage, drenched in neon visuals and brutality.
fields.special_features: Making-of Documentary (Examining neon horror aesthetics), Director’s Commentary (Exploring themes), Deleted Scenes (Extended sequences)
fields.censor_status: No censorship issues; widely praised for bold visuals
fields.packaging: Hardbound slipcover with vivid red artwork

fields.title: Maniac
fields.description: Frank Zito, a disturbed killer haunted by his abusive mother, prowls NYC murdering women. One of the grimiest entries in 1980s slasher cinema, elevated by Tom Savini’s unforgettable FX.
fields.special_features: 4K remaster from original negative. Audio commentary with William Lustig and Tom Savini. "The Joe Spinell Story" (49 min doc). Deleted scenes. Still gallery and trailers. 28-page booklet with essay by Michael Gingold
fields.censor_status: Banned in Germany and the UK during the Video Nasties era. Later released uncut.
fields.packaging: Embossed slipcover with lenticular artwork + booklet

fields.title: Manos: The Hands of Fate
fields.description: A bizarre low-budget horror about a cult leader with supernatural control.
fields.special_features: Restored Version (Remastered from original print), Documentary on Cult Legacy (Exploring the film’s infamous reputation), Audio Commentary (Film historians analyze production flaws)
fields.censor_status: No censorship issues but widely mocked for poor production

fields.title: Martin
fields.description: George A. Romero’s psychological vampire film exploring the nature of vampirism.
fields.special_features: Restored Print (High-definition transfer), Romero’s Commentary (Discussing influences), Deleted Scenes (Previously lost footage)
fields.censor_status: Released with minor cuts in the UK; later restored

fields.title: Mondo Cane
fields.description: A shocking documentary blending bizarre global rituals with exploitation-style filmmaking.
fields.special_features: Historical Context Featurette (Examining global cultures), Restored Edition (Enhanced transfer), Director’s Commentary (Discussing impact on cinema)
fields.censor_status: Some versions censored due to graphic real-life scenes
fields.packaging: Embossed slipcase with vintage documentary styling

fields.title: Ms. 45
fields.description: After being assaulted twice in one day, a mute seamstress turns vigilante in Abel Ferrara’s gritty, feminist revenge film.
fields.special_features: 2K restoration. Commentary with Ferrara. "Femme Fatale: Zoë Lund Remembered" (28 min). Theatrical and promo trailers. 20-page booklet with new essays
fields.censor_status: Heavily cut in UK VHS release (1980s); now uncut
fields.packaging: Slipcase with reversible sleeve and booklet

fields.title: Naked Lunch
fields.description: Cronenberg adapts William S. Burroughs’ hallucinatory novel into a surreal vision of addiction, paranoia, and Kafkaesque bureaucracy.
fields.special_features: New 2K restoration. Commentary with Cronenberg and actor Peter Weller. Interviews with crew and Burroughs scholars. Archival making-of featurette. 36-page booklet with artwork and essays
fields.censor_status: Mildly censored in some European TV broadcasts due to drug content
fields.packaging: Criterion case with illustrated insert + booklet

fields.title: Nekromantik
fields.description: A shocking horror film about necrophilia and disturbing romance.
fields.special_features: Director’s Interview. Discussing the film’s impact and censorship. Uncut Version. Features sequences previously banned. Special Gore Effects Breakdown. How the visuals were achieved.
fields.censor_status: Banned outright in the UK until recently released in uncensored format.

fields.title: Nightbreed
fields.description: Clive Barker’s monster-filled horror-fantasy about an underground society of creatures.
fields.special_features: Director’s Cut (Includes restored sequences), Behind-the-Scenes Documentary (Exploring creature effects), Deleted Scenes (Extended footage)
fields.censor_status: Originally censored in the UK for violent imagery; later released fully uncut

fields.title: Onibaba
fields.description: A stark and eerie black-and-white Japanese horror film set in feudal times, where two women survive by murdering samurai and selling their goods.
fields.special_features: New HD transfer from 35mm print. Interviews with Kaneto Shindō. Audio commentary by Asian horror scholar. Illustrated booklet. Theatrical trailer
fields.censor_status: Uncut worldwide

fields.title: Paris, Texas
fields.description: Wim Wenders’ haunting story of a man reconnecting with his son and estranged wife across the American landscape. Stunning visuals and Ry Cooder’s score elevate this classic.
fields.special_features: 4K restoration from original negative. Interviews with Wim Wenders and cast. Commentary by author Peter Cowie. Deleted scenes. 48-page booklet
fields.censor_status: Uncut worldwide

fields.title: Peeping Tom
fields.description: A psychological thriller about a film-obsessed killer documenting his murders.
fields.special_features: Restored Print (Digitally enhanced version), Director’s Commentary (Examining themes of voyeurism), Behind-the-Scenes Documentary (Exploring production challenges)
fields.censor_status: Initially condemned as obscene in the UK; later reassessed as a classic
fields.packaging: Hardbound slipcase with film reel-style artwork

fields.title: Phantom of the Paradise
fields.description: Brian De Palma’s cult rock opera blending horror, music, and satire.
fields.special_features: Director’s Commentary (Exploring influences), Deleted Scenes (Recovered lost footage), Making-of Featurette (Examining musical elements)
fields.censor_status: No censorship issues but was underappreciated on release

fields.title: Phase IV
fields.description: The only film directed by famed graphic designer Saul Bass, blending science fiction and experimental visuals in a tale of hyper-intelligent ants.
fields.special_features: 4K restoration. Commentary by Jonathan Rigby. Rare alternate ending. Archival making-of stills. Saul Bass design retrospective
fields.censor_status: Uncut worldwide
fields.packaging: Clear case with booklet and alternate art

fields.title: Pink Flamingos
fields.description: John Waters’ shock comedy featuring Divine in a contest for the filthiest person alive. One of the most infamous underground films.
fields.special_features: New 4K restoration. Commentary by Waters. Interviews with cast (incl. Divine archival). Deleted scenes + trailers. 28-page booklet
fields.censor_status: Banned in multiple countries; uncut since 2000s

fields.title: Pinocchio’s Revenge
fields.description: A bizarre horror film about a murderous wooden puppet wreaking havoc.
fields.special_features: Restored Print (HD remaster), Director’s Commentary (Examining slasher influences), Deleted Scenes (Extended sequences)
fields.censor_status: Not censored but regarded as obscure in horror circles

fields.title: Possession
fields.description: A woman’s breakdown unravels into supernatural horror and domestic madness. Andrzej Żuławski’s cult psychological horror is a wild, symbolic ride.
fields.special_features: 2K restoration by Second Sight. 3 audio commentaries. "The Other Side of the Wall" doc (52 min). Interview with Żuławski and Isabelle Adjani. 80-page hardback book
fields.censor_status: Banned in the UK as a "Video Nasty"; uncut since 1999
fields.packaging: Rigid box with 3 discs, hardback book, art cards

fields.title: Q: The Winged Serpent
fields.description: A bizarre horror-action hybrid about an ancient dragon terrorizing New York City.
fields.special_features: Monster Effects Breakdown (Examining stop-motion techniques), Director’s Commentary (Discussing inspiration), Deleted Scenes (Unused footage)
fields.censor_status: No censorship issues but regarded as an odd cult film
fields.packaging: Slipcase featuring retro monster movie design

fields.title: Re-Animator
fields.description: A horror-comedy based on H.P. Lovecraft’s tale of reanimated corpses and twisted science.
fields.special_features: Behind-the-Scenes Documentary (Insights into practical effects), Unrated Cut (Restored graphic content), Cast Interviews (Discussing cult status)
fields.censor_status: Originally cut in the UK, later released fully uncut

fields.title: Repo Man
fields.description: Otto, a disillusioned punk, gets pulled into the world of car repossession and a surreal government conspiracy involving a radioactive Chevy Malibu. Alex Cox’s cult debut is a satirical sci-fi masterpiece.
fields.special_features: New 2K digital transfer, supervised by Alex Cox. Audio commentary by Alex Cox and producer Michael Nesmith. "Repossessed": retrospective documentary (30 min). Interviews with Cox, Estevez, Sy Richardson. Original theatrical trailer, TV spots. Booklet with essay by critic Sam McPheeters (24 pages)
fields.censor_status: Heavily edited for TV broadcast in 1980s; uncensored for home release
fields.packaging: Standard Criterion keep case with illustrated booklet

fields.title: Riki-Oh: The Story of Ricky
fields.description: An ultraviolent Hong Kong martial arts gorefest, known for its cartoonish brutality and insane prison fights.
fields.special_features: HD transfer from Fortune Star. Cantonese and English dub. Interview with Fan Siu-Wong. Trailers and commentary. Reversible cover art
fields.censor_status: Heavily censored in UK and US on VHS

fields.title: Rubber
fields.description: A surreal film about a sentient, killer tire wreaking havoc.
fields.special_features: Director’s Commentary (Examining absurd storytelling), Making-of Documentary (Exploring visual techniques), Deleted Scenes (Extended sequences)
fields.censor_status: No censorship issues; widely released uncut
fields.packaging: Slipcase with unique textured rubber-themed artwork

fields.title: Rubin & Ed
fields.description: Crispin Glover and Howard Hesseman star in this absurd buddy comedy about a man trying to bury his frozen cat. Cult to the core.
fields.special_features: HD scan from archival print. Interview with Trent Harris. "Crispin Goes Off" video. Original trailer. Liner notes
fields.censor_status: Uncut worldwide

fields.title: Salò, or the 120 Days of Sodom
fields.description: A deeply disturbing film based on de Sade’s novel, depicting extreme cruelty.
fields.special_features: Director’s Interview. Pier Paolo Pasolini discusses the film’s themes. Historical Context Featurette. Exploring fascism and repression in the film. Restored Cut. High-quality version after years of censorship.
fields.censor_status: Banned in the UK for years, only later released in a cut format before full restoration.
fields.packaging: Slipcase with stark minimalist design reflecting film’s themes.

fields.title: Santa Sangre
fields.description: A baroque and bloody masterpiece from Alejandro Jodorowsky, blending circus horror, psychodrama, and trauma.
fields.special_features: 2K restoration supervised by Jodorowsky. Multiple interviews. Commentary by Alan Jones. Documentary: "Forget Everything You Have Ever Seen". Booklet
fields.censor_status: Uncut worldwide

fields.title: Scanners
fields.description: Telepaths wage a psychic war in this body horror sci-fi classic from David Cronenberg, famous for its head-exploding scene.
fields.special_features: 2K restoration approved by Cronenberg. "The Scanners Way" doc (52 min). 2013 interview with Michael Ironside. Trailer, stills, and rare promotional video. 40-page booklet
fields.censor_status: Uncut worldwide

fields.title: Seconds
fields.description: Directed by John Frankenheimer, this sci-fi cult classic stars Rock Hudson as a man who undergoes extreme surgery to begin a new life. A paranoid, Kafkaesque thriller.
fields.special_features: 4K restoration. Audio commentary by Frankenheimer. Archival Rock Hudson interview. Featurette: "A Second Look". Deleted scenes
fields.censor_status: Uncut worldwide

fields.title: Shogun Assassin
fields.description: A re-edited mash-up of Lone Wolf and Cub, this hyper-violent samurai epic became a cult hit in the US grindhouse circuit.
fields.special_features: Restored HD presentation. Interview with producer David Weisman. Commentary by film historians. Artwork gallery and liner notes
fields.censor_status: Uncut but heavily edited from source material

fields.title: Singapore Sling
fields.description: A deeply disturbing Greek film mixing noir, horror, and surrealism.
fields.special_features: Restored Edition (Enhanced visuals), Director’s Commentary (Exploring surrealist influences), Uncut Version (Includes sequences previously omitted)
fields.censor_status: Faced censorship battles for extreme graphic content

fields.title: Society
fields.description: A Beverly Hills teen discovers the elite are literally consuming the lower classes. A blend of satire, surrealism, and stomach-turning effects.
fields.special_features: 2K restoration. Commentary by Brian Yuzna & Billy Warlock. "Masters of the Hunt" FX doc (22 min). Interviews with FX team and cast. Exclusive Arrow art cards. 24-page collector’s booklet with essay by Alan Jones
fields.censor_status: Briefly banned in Spain; uncut worldwide now
fields.packaging: Slipcover with reversible sleeve + art cards + booklet

fields.title: Spider Baby
fields.description: A cult horror-comedy about a bizarre family suffering from a degenerative disease.
fields.special_features: Behind-the-Scenes Documentary (Examining odd horror humor), Deleted Scenes (Additional footage), Director’s Commentary (Discussing cult legacy)
fields.censor_status: No censorship issues; widely praised for unique storytelling
fields.packaging: Slipcase with eerie retro horror artwork

fields.title: Street Trash
fields.description: A gross-out horror comedy about toxic liquor that causes violent body meltdowns.
fields.special_features: Effects Breakdown (How the melting gore was achieved), Restored Print (High-definition transfer), Cast Reunion Interview (Reflecting on the cult status)
fields.censor_status: Not banned but heavily criticized for extreme content

fields.title: Suspiria
fields.description: A ballet student uncovers a coven of witches in a color-drenched nightmare. Argento’s horror classic is lauded for its lighting, music, and set design.
fields.special_features: 4K restoration supervised by TLE Films. Commentary with Troy Howarth. "Do You Know Anything About Witches?" doc (52 min). Goblin concert footage. 40-page booklet and original soundtrack CD
fields.censor_status: Censored in UK, Germany (1970s); now uncut

fields.title: Sweet Movie
fields.description: A surreal, sexually provocative and politically charged film by Dušan Makavejev, banned in many countries for graphic content.
fields.special_features: HD transfer supervised by the director. Archival interviews. Illustrated essay booklet. Trailers and alternate scenes. Controversy featurette
fields.censor_status: Banned in UK and Canada

fields.title: Tetsuo: The Iron Man
fields.description: A man transforms into a metallic creature in this black-and-white cyberpunk nightmare.
fields.special_features: HD restoration approved by director. Interviews with Shinya Tsukamoto. Behind-the-scenes footage. Short film "The Adventures of Electric Rod Boy". Booklet with Tsukamoto interview
fields.censor_status: Uncut worldwide

fields.title: The Baby
fields.description: A twisted and bizarre horror-drama about a grown man who lives as an infant, and the mysterious social worker investigating his family.
fields.special_features: Remastered HD print. Commentary by film historian Travis Crawford. Archival interviews. Alternate artwork and trailer gallery. Booklet with essay
fields.censor_status: Uncut worldwide

fields.title: The Beyond
fields.description: A woman inherits a hotel that turns out to be one of the seven gates of hell. Fulci’s gory masterpiece mixes dream logic and occult horror.
fields.special_features: 4K restoration from original negative by Grindhouse Releasing. 2 audio commentaries (Catriona MacColl + Stephen Thrower). "Lucio Fulci: In His Own Words" (50 min). Soundtrack CD (Fabio Frizzi score). Extensive gallery, trailers. 32-page booklet with essays by Anton Bitel and David Flint
fields.censor_status: Banned in Germany and UK (Video Nasties list); now uncut
fields.packaging: Rigid slipcase with reversible sleeve + soundtrack CD

fields.title: The Brood
fields.description: David Cronenberg’s psychological body horror about a woman whose rage manifests in the form of monstrous children.
fields.special_features: 2K restoration. Commentary by David Cronenberg. "Birth Pains" featurette. Archival behind-the-scenes. Booklet by Kim Newman
fields.censor_status: Originally trimmed for violence in UK
fields.packaging: Clear case with artwork and booklet

fields.title: The Burning
fields.description: A classic slasher inspired by urban legends, featuring a brutal revenge plot.
fields.special_features: Restored Print (Remastered picture and sound), Uncut Version (Previously censored scenes), Behind-the-Scenes Documentary (Examining production challenges)
fields.censor_status: Initially censored in the UK due to extreme violence; later released fully uncut
fields.packaging: Hardcase slipcover with embossed fiery artwork

fields.title: The Cell
fields.description: A psychological sci-fi thriller about a therapist entering a serial killer’s mind.
fields.special_features: Restored Cut (High-definition transfer), Behind-the-Scenes Featurette (Examining visuals), Director’s Commentary (Discussing themes)
fields.censor_status: No censorship issues but regarded as unsettling

fields.title: The Cook, the Thief, His Wife & Her Lover
fields.description: Peter Greenaway’s lavish and grotesque critique of consumerism, betrayal, and revenge, set in a decadent French restaurant.
fields.special_features: 2K remaster. Commentary with Greenaway. "Food and Filth" featurette. Rare behind-the-scenes footage. 40-page booklet with essays
fields.censor_status: Censored in US until NC-17 release

fields.title: The Devils
fields.description: Ken Russell’s violent and controversial story of demonic possession and political power in 17th-century France, starring Oliver Reed and Vanessa Redgrave.
fields.special_features: UK X-rated cut with optional commentary. "Hell on Earth" documentary. Interview with Ken Russell. Audio essay on censorship history. Booklet with banned scenes analysis
fields.censor_status: Heavily censored; full version still unreleased officially

fields.title: The Driller Killer
fields.description: Abel Ferrara’s gritty underground horror about an artist driven to madness. Notorious Video Nasty.
fields.special_features: 2K restoration. Commentary by Ferrara. Making-of featurette. Trailer gallery. Essay booklet
fields.censor_status: Banned in UK (Video Nasty)

fields.title: The Forbidden Room
fields.description: A surreal adventure blending old silent film aesthetics with bizarre narratives.
fields.special_features: Behind-the-Scenes Documentary (Examining unique filmmaking techniques), Restored Scenes (Additional material reinserted), Director’s Commentary (Exploring visual design)
fields.censor_status: No censorship issues; widely praised for originality
fields.packaging: Hardcover slipcase with vintage film-style artwork

fields.title: The Funhouse
fields.description: A slasher horror set inside a terrifying carnival attraction with deadly secrets.
fields.special_features: Behind-the-Scenes Documentary (Exploring creepy carnival aesthetics), Deleted Scenes (Extended footage), Director’s Commentary (Examining slasher elements)
fields.censor_status: No censorship issues but considered unsettling
fields.packaging: Slipcase featuring retro carnival horror styling

fields.title: The Greasy Strangler
fields.description: A grotesque horror-comedy following a father and son operating a bizarre business.
fields.special_features: Director’s Commentary (Examining absurd humor), Deleted Scenes (Extended sequences), Behind-the-Scenes Featurette (Exploring exaggerated aesthetics)
fields.censor_status: No censorship issues but regarded as shockingly crude
fields.packaging: Slipcase with neon-colored artwork reflecting bizarre themes

fields.title: The Happiness of the Katakuris
fields.description: Takashi Miike’s genre-bending zombie musical comedy, blending claymation, horror, and heartfelt drama.
fields.special_features: Remastered HD transfer. Interview with Miike. Audio commentary. Original trailers. Collector’s booklet
fields.censor_status: Uncut worldwide

fields.title: The Holy Mountain
fields.description: A thief is guided by a mystical alchemist on a surreal spiritual journey through greed, power, and illusion. Jodorowsky’s definitive psychedelic film.
fields.special_features: 2K restoration supervised by Alejandro Jodorowsky. Director’s commentary. "The Tarot as Filmmaking" lecture (40 min). Deleted scenes with commentary. 48-page hardcover booklet with essays, artwork. Archival interviews with Jodorowsky
fields.censor_status: Banned in UK and US in 1970s for blasphemous imagery; restored in 2007
fields.packaging: Hard case with art cards + hardcover booklet

fields.title: The Hourglass Sanatorium
fields.description: A surreal Polish fantasy-horror blending dreamlike imagery and mysterious storytelling.
fields.special_features: Restored Edition (Enhanced visuals and sound), Behind-the-Scenes Documentary (Exploring production design), Director’s Commentary (Analyzing surreal themes)
fields.censor_status: No censorship issues but remained obscure internationally
fields.packaging: Hardcover slipcase with vintage artistic styling

fields.title: The House by the Cemetery
fields.description: A chilling Italian horror film involving a haunted house hiding dark secrets.
fields.special_features: Restored Print (Enhanced visuals and sound), Lucio Fulci Interview (Discussing the film’s legacy), Deleted Scenes (Scenes cut for pacing)
fields.censor_status: Initially released with cuts in the UK; later uncut versions available
fields.packaging: Glossy slipcase with atmospheric cover art

fields.title: The House That Jack Built
fields.description: Lars von Trier’s disturbing psychological drama about a meticulous serial killer.
fields.special_features: Uncut Version (Restores censored sequences), Director’s Commentary (Exploring controversial themes), Making-of Featurette (Examining artistic intent)
fields.censor_status: Originally censored in the UK due to graphic violence; later released fully uncut

fields.title: The Howling
fields.description: A groundbreaking werewolf horror known for its stunning transformation effects.
fields.special_features: Director’s Commentary (Discussing visual effects and themes), Behind-the-Scenes Documentary (Examining transformation sequences), Deleted Scenes (Restored material)
fields.censor_status: No censorship issues; widely praised for practical effects

fields.title: The Keep
fields.description: Michael Mann’s visually ambitious but studio-interfered gothic horror set in WWII, featuring Nazis, ancient evil, and Tangerine Dream's score.
fields.special_features: Rare transfer from 35mm print. Fan commentary and restoration notes. Tangerine Dream isolated score. Trailer. Poster art gallery
fields.censor_status: Cut by Paramount (never officially restored)
fields.packaging: Clear case with printed disc art

fields.title: The Last House on the Left
fields.description: Wes Craven’s disturbing revenge thriller about kidnapped teenagers and brutal consequences.
fields.special_features: Making-of Documentary (Insights into production), Uncut Version (Previously censored sequences included), Slasher Influence Featurette (Impact on horror genre)
fields.censor_status: Initially banned in the UK, later released with cuts; full version restored

fields.title: The Last Wave
fields.description: Peter Weir’s mysterious Australian cult film merges legal drama and Aboriginal mysticism, exploring apocalyptic visions and ancient prophecy.
fields.special_features: New 2K scan. Interviews with Peter Weir. Commentary with critic Alexandra Heller-Nicholas. "Dreaming the Apocalypse" doc. Trailers and still gallery
fields.censor_status: Uncut worldwide

fields.title: The Legend of the Holy Drinker
fields.description: Directed by Ermanno Olmi and based on the novella by Joseph Roth, this allegorical tale follows a homeless man in Paris granted a chance at redemption. Cult status stems from its meditative tone and rare release history.
fields.special_features: 2K digital restoration. New interview with screenwriter Tullio Kezich. Archival Olmi interviews. Collector’s booklet with critical analysis
fields.censor_status: Uncut worldwide

fields.title: The Love Witch
fields.description: A beautifully stylized horror-comedy paying homage to 1960s witchcraft cinema.
fields.special_features: Making-of Documentary (Examining retro production design), Director’s Commentary (Exploring feminist themes), Cast Interviews (Reflecting on cult status)
fields.censor_status: No censorship issues; released in full

fields.title: The Man Who Fell to Earth
fields.description: A sci-fi drama about an alien struggling to survive on Earth.
fields.special_features: Restored Edition (Enhanced picture and sound), David Bowie Interview (Discussing role), Behind-the-Scenes Featurette (Examining production design)
fields.censor_status: No censorship issues but considered intellectually challenging

fields.title: The Naked Lunch
fields.description: David Cronenberg’s adaptation of the surreal William Burroughs novel, blending science fiction and hallucinatory horror.
fields.special_features: Behind-the-Scenes Featurette (Examining Burroughs' influence), Restored Cut (Enhanced visuals), Director’s Commentary (Discussing surreal elements)
fields.censor_status: No censorship issues but widely debated for bizarre content

fields.title: The Night of the Hunter
fields.description: A noir thriller about a sinister preacher hunting two children for hidden loot.
fields.special_features: Director’s Commentary (Insight into stylistic choices), Restored Cut (Remastered edition), Behind-the-Scenes Documentary (Filmmaking process)
fields.censor_status: No censorship issues; released intact

fields.title: The Ninth Configuration
fields.description: A surreal psychological thriller set in a military asylum.
fields.special_features: Restored Print (High-definition transfer), Behind-the-Scenes Documentary (Examining themes), Director’s Commentary (Discussing story development)
fields.censor_status: No censorship issues but widely underappreciated

fields.title: The Paperhouse
fields.description: A dark fantasy film about a young girl trapped in a surreal world she draws.
fields.special_features: Director’s Commentary (Exploring dreamlike themes), Remastered Cut (Fully restored version), Deleted Scenes (Additional footage)
fields.censor_status: No censorship issues; widely appreciated in cult circles

fields.title: The Reflecting Skin
fields.description: A young boy’s imagination merges with dark reality in this haunting Gothic mystery set in rural 1950s America.
fields.special_features: 2K restoration approved by director. Commentary with Philip Ridley. Interview with Viggo Mortensen. Illustrated collector's booklet. Trailer
fields.censor_status: Uncut worldwide

fields.title: The Shout
fields.description: A psychological horror about a man who claims he can kill with a supernatural scream.
fields.special_features: Director’s Commentary (Exploring tension-building techniques), Making-of Documentary (Examining eerie sound design), Deleted Scenes (Extended sequences)
fields.censor_status: No censorship issues but remained obscure for years
fields.packaging: Hardcover slipcase with retro artistic styling

fields.title: The Strange Color of Your Body's Tears
fields.description: A neo-giallo horror with striking visuals and cryptic storytelling.
fields.special_features: Restored Print (Fully enhanced visuals), Behind-the-Scenes Documentary (Examining giallo influences), Director’s Commentary (Discussing surreal cinematography)
fields.censor_status: No censorship issues but regarded as deeply unsettling
fields.packaging: Slipcase with stylish neon giallo aesthetics

fields.title: The Strange Vice of Mrs. Wardh
fields.description: A stylish Italian giallo horror following a woman caught in a web of murder and manipulation.
fields.special_features: Restored Cut (High-quality transfer), Deleted Scenes (Previously lost footage), Director’s Commentary (Exploring psychological themes)
fields.censor_status: No censorship issues; released intact
fields.packaging: Slipcase with vintage Italian horror aesthetic

fields.title: The Stuff
fields.description: A satirical horror film about a delicious but deadly alien substance taking over consumers.
fields.special_features: Making-of Documentary (Examining campy horror themes), Deleted Scenes (Unused sequences), Director’s Commentary (Discussing corporate satire)
fields.censor_status: No censorship issues; widely enjoyed as a cult horror-comedy

fields.title: The Texas Chainsaw Massacre
fields.description: A gritty horror classic about a deranged family and their chainsaw-wielding killer.
fields.special_features: Behind-the-Scenes Featurette. Interviews with cast and crew. Deleted Scenes. Never-before-seen footage cut from the original film. Slasher Documentary. Analysis of the film’s influence on the genre.
fields.censor_status: Originally banned in the UK before being approved with cuts. Fully uncut versions later released.
fields.packaging: Retro VHS-style packaging with leather texture.

fields.title: The Texas Chainsaw Massacre 2
fields.description: Tobe Hooper returns with a wild, satirical, ultra-violent sequel to his horror classic. Over-the-top and drenched in gore.
fields.special_features: 2K scan. Commentary by Hooper. "It Runs in the Family" doc. Deleted scenes. Collector’s booklet
fields.censor_status: Heavily censored in UK, now uncut

fields.title: The Thing
fields.description: In Antarctica, a shape-shifting alien infiltrates a remote research base. Carpenter’s claustrophobic sci-fi horror was misunderstood on release but gained legendary status.
fields.special_features: New 4K restoration by Arrow. Commentary with Carpenter and Kurt Russell. "Who Goes There?" making-of doc (90 min). Vintage featurettes, trailers, stills gallery. 60-page hardcover booklet
fields.censor_status: Uncut worldwide; initial reviews criticized violence
fields.packaging: Rigid slipbox with 4K disc, poster, booklet

fields.title: The Toxic Avenger
fields.description: Troma's iconic cult splatter comedy about a nerd turned mutant superhero after falling into toxic waste. Irreverent, gory, and bizarre.
fields.special_features: Uncut director's cut. "Birth of a Hero" doc. Lloyd Kaufman commentary. Behind-the-scenes footage. Collector’s postcard and reversible art
fields.censor_status: Censored in UK and Australia

fields.title: The Visitor
fields.description: A surreal sci-fi horror blending biblical themes and extraterrestrial mystery.
fields.special_features: Director’s Commentary (Examining unique themes), Behind-the-Scenes Documentary (Exploring visual techniques), Deleted Scenes (Extended sequences)
fields.censor_status: No censorship issues but largely forgotten upon release

fields.title: The Warriors
fields.description: A street gang must fight its way back home through hostile NYC after being framed for murder. Stylish, tense, and hugely influential.
fields.special_features: Theatrical and Director’s Cut. "Come Out to Play" retrospective doc. Interviews with cast and crew. Featurette on the original novel. Collector’s booklet
fields.censor_status: Uncut worldwide; theatrical version rarely seen until recent re-release
fields.packaging: Standard case with slipcover and insert

fields.title: The Wicker Man
fields.description: A devout police sergeant investigates a missing girl on a remote island and encounters pagan rituals in this iconic British folk horror.
fields.special_features: Final Cut, Director’s Cut, and Theatrical versions. Commentary with Robin Hardy and Christopher Lee. "Worshipping The Wicker Man" doc (34 min). Interview with Edward Woodward. 48-page booklet with essays and restored photos
fields.censor_status: Original US release heavily cut (1970s); now restored.
fields.packaging: Rigid box with 3-disc digipack + booklet + poster

fields.title: The Wicker Tree
fields.description: A spiritual sequel to The Wicker Man, this film explores the culture clash between devout American Christians and a Scottish pagan cult. Directed by Robin Hardy.
fields.special_features: Audio commentary with Robin Hardy. Behind-the-scenes documentary. Deleted scenes. Interview with Christopher Lee. Trailer
fields.censor_status: Uncut worldwide

fields.title: The Witch Who Came from the Sea
fields.description: A psychological horror about a woman’s descent into hallucinations and murder.
fields.special_features: Making-of Documentary (Examining cult horror), Deleted Scenes (Extended sequences), Director’s Commentary (Exploring storytelling techniques)
fields.censor_status: Originally banned in the UK under the "Video Nasties" list; later released uncut

fields.title: They Live
fields.description: A drifter discovers a pair of sunglasses that reveal subliminal messages and aliens controlling the world. A satirical sci-fi cult favorite by John Carpenter.
fields.special_features: 2K restoration from original negative. Commentary with John Carpenter and Roddy Piper. "Independent Thoughts" interview with Carpenter (20 min). Vintage TV spots and trailers. Reversible sleeve + 20-page booklet
fields.censor_status: Uncut worldwide

fields.title: Thundercrack!
fields.description: A bizarre underground cult film blending horror, surrealism, and explicit content.
fields.special_features: Uncut Version (Previously censored sequences restored), Making-of Documentary (Examining avant-garde style), Deleted Scenes (Extended sequences)
fields.censor_status: Faced censorship battles due to explicit material
fields.packaging: Matte-black slipcase featuring surreal vintage artwork

fields.title: Time Bandits
fields.description: A boy joins a time-traveling troupe of dwarfs stealing treasure from history in Terry Gilliam’s dark fantasy adventure.
fields.special_features: 2K restoration approved by Gilliam. Commentary with Gilliam and cast. "The Directors: Terry Gilliam" doc. Interview with David Warner. Collector booklet with film stills
fields.censor_status: Uncut worldwide

fields.title: Tokyo Drifter
fields.description: A former yakuza hitman tries to go straight but is drawn into a psychedelic spiral of betrayal and stylized violence.
fields.special_features: HD transfer, uncompressed audio. Commentary by Tony Rayns. Interview with Seijun Suzuki (17 min). Original trailers. Booklet with essay by Howard Hampton
fields.censor_status: Mildly cut on early Japanese TV broadcasts for violence

fields.title: Tokyo Gore Police
fields.description: In a dystopian Tokyo, a samurai-cop battles grotesque mutants in this ultraviolent Japanese body horror action hybrid.
fields.special_features: Making-of doc. Commentary with director Yoshihiro Nishimura. Special FX featurette. Trailers and behind-the-scenes reel. Poster and booklet
fields.censor_status: Uncut in Japan; censored in US on DVD release

fields.title: Valerie and Her Week of Wonders
fields.description: A surreal fairy tale blending horror, fantasy, and sexuality, set in a dreamlike Czech landscape. A key work of 70s arthouse.
fields.special_features: New 4K transfer. Audio commentary. Archival short films by Jaromil Jireš. Illustrated booklet. New subtitle translation
fields.censor_status: Uncut worldwide

fields.title: Vampyros Lesbos
fields.description: A surreal erotic horror film by Jess Franco, starring Soledad Miranda as a seductive female vampire in a dreamlike world.
fields.special_features: Restored from original elements. Alternate opening credits. Jess Franco interviews. Vintage soundtrack featurette. Collector’s insert booklet
fields.censor_status: Censored in UK, Germany

fields.title: Videodrome
fields.description: A sleazy cable-TV exec stumbles upon a brutal signal that warps reality. Cronenberg’s tech-noir horror predicts media obsession and body modification.
fields.special_features: Restored HD transfer supervised by David Cronenberg. Audio commentary with Cronenberg and Mark Irwin. "Forging the New Flesh" doc (26 min). Vintage featurette with Rick Baker (18 min). "Samurai Dreams" full video. Theatrical trailers and stills. 40-page booklet with essays and production notes
fields.censor_status: Cut in UK (1983); banned in some provinces in Canada for graphic content. Now fully uncut.
fields.packaging: Clear Criterion keep case with booklet

fields.title: Wake in Fright
fields.description: A harrowing descent into the Australian outback, where civilized exteriors give way to primal madness. A lost classic, now restored.
fields.special_features: Restored by National Film and Sound Archive of Australia. Interview with Ted Kotcheff. "To Wake in Fright" doc. Booklet with historical analysis
fields.censor_status: Censored and thought lost for decades

fields.title: Who Can Kill a Child?
fields.description: A chilling Spanish horror film about a couple trapped on an island where children have turned murderous.
fields.special_features: Restored Print (High-quality transfer), Behind-the-Scenes Documentary (Examining psychological horror), Director’s Commentary (Exploring moral dilemmas)
fields.censor_status: Originally censored in the UK for disturbing child violence; later released uncut

fields.title: Wild at Heart
fields.description: David Lynch’s surreal road movie romance starring Nicolas Cage and Laura Dern, blending violence, sex, and Wizard of Oz references.
fields.special_features: 4K scan from original negative. Lynch-approved audio mix. "Love and Chaos" making-of doc. Deleted scenes and trailers. Interview with Laura Dern
fields.censor_status: Uncut worldwide

fields.title: Xtro
fields.description: A surreal sci-fi horror about alien abduction and grotesque mutations.
fields.special_features: Director’s Commentary (Discussing inspirations), Deleted Scenes (Restored explicit sequences), Practical Effects Breakdown (Examining creature design)
fields.censor_status: Originally censored in the UK; later released in full

fields.title: Zardoz
fields.description: Sean Connery in a red diaper. John Boorman’s psychedelic sci-fi cult messiah story, loved for its weirdness.
fields.special_features: 4K remaster. Commentary by Boorman. Interviews and essays. Retrospective doc. Alternate art gallery
fields.censor_status: Uncut worldwide
